net.proteusframework.core.locale

Interface LocaleSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CachingLocaleSource, JDBCLocaleSource, ResourceBundleAdapter

    public interface LocaleSource
    Implementations of this interface store, update, retrieve, and remove LocalizedObjects. The modifying operations are typically used by an application to create and update LocalizedObjects. The LocaleContext implementations generally only call retrieve(LocalizedObjectKey, Locale, Class, boolean) on a LocaleSource. All implementations must support static keys in the form of sybmolic names. When LocalizedObjects are updated a LocaleSource implementation is required to broadcast the event to all LocaleSourceListeners.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • addLocalizedObjectChangedListener

        void addLocalizedObjectChangedListener(LocaleSourceListener locl)
        Add a localized object changed listener. A weak reference is used interally, so the caller must maintain a strong reference for the desired lifetime of the listener.
        Parameters:
        locl - the listener to add

      • clearLocalizedObjectChangedListeners

        void clearLocalizedObjectChangedListeners()
        Clear the list of localized object change listeners.

      • getAllUsedLocales

        Collection<Locale> getAllUsedLocales()
                                     throws LocaleSourceException,
                                            UnsupportedOperationException
        Get the set of all locales for which this store has data.
        Returns:
        all of the locales for which this store has data.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - error accessing persistence store.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the locale source implementation doesn't support querying locales.

      • getLocalesByKey

        Collection<Locale> getLocalesByKey(LocalizedObjectKey pKey)
                                   throws LocaleSourceException,
                                          UnsupportedOperationException
        Get the set of locales that the given key has values for.
        Parameters:
        pKey - the key
        Returns:
        collection of locales
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if there is an error accessing persistence store.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the locale source implementation doesn't support querying locales.

      • getParent

        LocaleSource getParent()
        Gets the parent LocaleSource. This method is used to obtain the LocaleSource that is being delegated to or wrapped by another LocaleSource implementation.
        Returns:
        the parent or null if this LocaleSource implementation does not have a parent.

      • invalidate

        void invalidate(LocalizedObject lo,
              Locale locale)
        Invalidate cache for a LocalizedObject modification if this locale source supports caching. Also invalidates the parent LocaleSource (if one exists). All cached instances for the key and same language (regardless of country and variant) should be invalidated as well since a fallback mechanism may provide the text for a locale other than the one specified.
        Parameters:
        lo - The LocalizedObject to invalidate.
        locale - the Locale identifying the object to invalidate in the cache. May be null to indicate that all localizations for a given key should be localized.

      • remove

        void remove(LocalizedObjectKey lok,
          Locale locale)
            throws LocaleSourceException
        Removes the localization for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        lok - the localized object key.
        locale - the locale. Optional. If null, the all localizations are removed.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource

      • removeLocalizedObjectChangedListener

        void removeLocalizedObjectChangedListener(LocaleSourceListener locl)
        Remove localized object changed listener.
        Parameters:
        locl - the listener to remove

      • resolveKey

        LocalizedObjectKey resolveKey(LocalizedObjectKey key)
                              throws LocaleSourceException
        Resolve a key. This will populate the database identifier into the key as well as the symbolic name. The keys are guaranteed to be equals, but may not be the same (identity).
        Parameters:
        key - the key. May be null.
        Returns:
        the resolved key or null if there is no localization for the specified key.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource.

      • retrieve

        <L extends LocalizedObject> L retrieve(LocalizedObjectKey key,
                                     Locale locale,
                                     Class<L> typeHint,
                                     boolean fallBack)
                                   throws LocaleSourceException
        Retrieve the LocalizedObject for the specified key and locale. Implementations can optionally return another object if the localized object cannot be found for a specific locale. If the key is not found, then the implementation must throw an exception. If the key is static, then the real key must be stored with the symbolic name. This is the same as calling resolveKey(LocalizedObjectKey). LocalizedObjects stored with a symbolic name should always return the symbolic name. The key specified must always be equal to the key returned with the LocalizedObject although they may not necessarily be the same key (identity).
        Type Parameters:
        L - the localized object parameter type.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        locale - the locale.
        typeHint - the type that is expected to be returned. Optional, may be null.
        fallBack - flag that indicates whether the returned object may be retrieved by falling back to less specific locales If the flag is false, then the object must be an exact match for the specified locale.
        Returns:
        the LocalizedObject. Never null.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject cannot be found or generated for the specified key and locale.

      • store

        <L extends LocalizedObject> L store(L lo,
                                  Locale locale)
                                throws LocaleSourceException
        Stores the LocalizedObject. The LocalizedObject must not have been previously stored for the specified locale.
        Type Parameters:
        L - the localized object parameter type.
        Parameters:
        lo - the object to store.
        locale - the locale to store
        Returns:
        a new LocalizedObject representing the data stored in the database.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject has already been stored for the specified Locale.

      • update

        void update(LocalizedObject lo,
          Locale locale)
            throws LocaleSourceException
        Updates the LocalizedObject. The LocalizedObject must have been previously stored for the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        lo - the object to store.
        locale - the locale to store
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject has not already been stored for the specified Locale.
